Source code for mycms.cmsapps.base

from django.shortcuts import render_to_response
from django.template import TemplateDoesNotExist
from django.shortcuts import render
from django.template import Context

class CMSPageView:
    """
    Base class for all CMSApp views. 
    """
    
    
    def __init__(self, request,template, content_type=None, status=None):
        self.request = request
        self.template = template
        self.context = Context()
        self.content_type = content_type
        self.status = status
    
    def user(self):
        """
        Returns the current user. None if not logged in.
        """
        pass
    
        
    
    def render(self):
        """
        The render function returns the rendered HTML page. The instance of this
        controller app is returned as a response object and Django calls this 
        render function to get the HTML page.
       
        Logic to produce all the atributes for the template can be done here. 
        """
        
        #render(request, template_name, context=context, content_type=content_type, status=status, using=using)
        
        if self.template == None:
            raise Exception("No TEMPLATE parameter provided inside the Controller.")
        return render(self.request, self.template, context=self.context.flatten())
     


[docs]class CMSAppController(object):
    """
    Base class for CMSApps controller. 
    """
    
    def __init__(self, request, cmsnode, *args, **kwargs):

        self.request = request
        self.arsg = args
        self.kwargs = kwargs
        self.cmsnode = cmsnode
        self.context = Context()
        self.pageview = self.VIEW(request, self.TEMPLATE)
